meanings: the remains of a wrecked plane

vlive.korean: 이겼으니까 한 잔해! Have a drink since you won! 듣기 View video 키워드#보아 - my SMTelevision : [키워드#보아] Ep.71 보아를 위해 준비했어!
vlive.english: Have a drink since you won!

vlive.korean: 잔해... 술 한잔 받으시게... Wreckage... Take a shot. 듣기 View video MAMAMOO : [MMMTV4] EP20 4season in Hongkong
이거 봐요 지금 잔해들이... Look, the aftermath of a makeup show. 듣기 View video KKOSISTERS : 워너원 부메랑 MV 메이크업 Wanna One Boomerang Makeup
vlive.english: Look, the aftermath of a makeup show.

vlive.korean: 잔해를 던진 건 너잖아... You were the one that threw the wreckage. 듣기 View video MAMAMOO : [MMMTV4] EP20 4season in Hongkong
vlive.english: You were the one that threw the wreckage.

vlive.korean: 저기 붙였잖아 니가! - 잔해! You made it stick to that! - The wreckage! 듣기 View video MAMAMOO : [MMMTV4] EP20 4season in Hongkong
vlive.english: You made it stick to that! - The wreckage!

examples.korean: Pieces of the wreckage were washed ashore. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 난파선 잔해들이 해안으로 쓸려 왔다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Pieces of the wreckage were washed ashore. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Six bodies were recovered from the wreckage. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 잔해에서 6구의 시신이 발견되었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Six bodies were recovered from the wreckage. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: A man was crawling away from the burning wreckage. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 한 남자가 불타는 잔해 속에서 기어 나왔다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: A man was crawling away from the burning wreckage. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: A few survivors were pulled from the wreckage. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 사고 잔해 속에서 몇 명의 생존자들이 끌려나왔다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: A few survivors were pulled from the wreckage. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: They found him pinned under the wreckage of the car. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들은 그 승용차 잔해 아래 갇혀 있는 그를 발견했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They found him pinned under the wreckage of the car. Add to Wordbook
